Cijo Jose
Timur Bagautdinov

Luc Van Gool
François Fleuret
dcterms:description: Wildtrack comprises real-world footage obtained from seven synchronized and calibrated cameras capturing an overlapping field-of-view of a 12×36 meter public area where pedestrian movement is unscripted. Ground plane annotations are provided on a 480×1440 grid, equating to 2.5 cm grid cells. On average, each frame contains 20 pedestrians covered by 3.74 cameras.
dcterms:title: Wildtrack

dcterms:creator: Yunzhong Hou
Liang Zheng
Stephen Gould
dcterms:description: MultiviewX is a synthetic dataset modeled close to the specification of the Wildtrack dataset using a game engine. It includes views from 6 virtual cameras with an overlapping field-of-view encompassing a slightly smaller area (16×25 meters). Annotations are provided on a ground plane grid of size 640×1000, with each grid representing the same 2.5 cm squares.
dcterms:title: MultiviewX

dcterms:creator: Fabian Herzog
Junpeng Chen
Torben Teepe
Johannes Gilg
Stefan Hörmann
Gerhard Rigoll
dcterms:description: Synthehicle is a synthetic dataset modeling intersections with cameras for intelligent cities in CARLA. It includes 3-8 cameras recording each intersection with a large overlapping area in the center. The dataset models various conditions such as day, dawn, night, and rain, and is annotated per camera with calibration.
dcterms:title: Synthehicle

dcterms:creator: James Ferryman
Ali Shahrokni
dcterms:description: PETS2009 is a dataset and challenge that focuses on performance evaluation of tracking and surveillance. It was one of the first modern tracking datasets and has been widely referenced in the context of multi-camera multi-target tracking.
dcterms:title: PETS2009
